alert.note: Alert for Jasper (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 10:16PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee and Jasper Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1016 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Galena, or 8 miles northwest of Joplin, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Joplin... Carthage... Webb City... Carl Junction... Galena... Oronogo... Carterville... Duquesne... Jasper... Airport Drive... Lowell... Alba... Purcell... Carytown... Asbury... Neck City... Avilla... Brooklyn Heights... Waco... Riverton... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 39 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
